DOC.HEAD: Commercial Titan Rocket Launch Postponed for Fourth Time
DOC.TEXT: Stiff high-altitude wind Tuesday night forced Martin Marietta to postpone for the fourth time the maiden launch of its commercial Titan 3 rocket. ``The upper level winds are too strong for Titan this evening,'' launch commentator Bob Gordon said. The announcement came after the countdown reached the five-minute mark and was held there for a weather evaluation. The launch was rescheduled for 7:21 p.m. Wednesday. The Titan 3 was to boost into orbit communications satellites for a Japanese company and the British Ministry of Defence. High wind at an altitude of 27,000 feet also caused a scrub Monday night. Technical and weather problems caused two postponements earlier in the month.
